all_paragraphs: By reading this piece, you will learn to create and deploy your own weather chatbot. At the end of this tutorial, you should have a basic chatbot that can respond appropriately in regards to the current weather, temperature and humidity when being asked by the users.
There are 4 sections in this tutorial:
Let’s proceed to the next section

For getting the weather data, I am going to use ClimaCell’s weather API. It comes with a free tier in which you can make up to 1000 call per day and 100 per hour which is more than enough for our use case.
Head over to the login page and sign up for it. You should see the following dashboard once you have logged into the main page.
Remember the API key as we are going to need it later on.

Let’s move on to the next section to implement the UI for our weather chatbot.

For this tutorial, I am going to use a readily available UI framework made by the team from Scalableminds. Head over to the following github repository and clone/download it into your machine. Unzip it and place all the files in a separate directory from the Rasa files.
The instruction provided by the official github page is based on yarn but I am going to use npm for this tutorial.

Open up a browser and go to the the following url
It should load the chatbot interface for you to test it. For now, it can only answer basic questions and provide you with information on the weather.
Congratulations for completing the tutorial. Let’s recap on what you have learned today.
We started off with signing up to get the apikey for access to weather data.

Then, we moved on to install the necessary packages such as Rasa. We modified the dataset to include an additional intent and stories for weather. Once we have completed the training, we started both the Action Server and Rasa Server.
For the Chatbot UI, we used a React-based component and serve it normally via npm run serve. You can easily extend and modify it based on your own preferences and use cases.
Thanks for reading this piece. Hope to see you again in the next tutorial!
